subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit 4.9 released!
msgSnippet: You mean all that stuff that the Maven Site plugin does for you ;-) Enjoy your leave.  Def a priority. Prob not a bad thing to have a bit of a delay, as there
messageBody:
You mean all that stuff that the Maven Site plugin does for you ;-)

Enjoy your leave. Def a priority.

Prob not a bad thing to have a bit of a delay, as there may be the odd other
issue that could go in that release.

2011/9/4 David Saff <david@...>

> Understood. Unfortunately, the (admittedly not huge) work to issue a
> 4.9.1 release with consistent links and documentation will likely be
> prohibitive until I'm off paternity leave.
>
> David
>
> 2011/9/3 Neale Upstone <neale.upstone@...>:
> > I agree.
> >
> > For releases, there is no ability to overwrite, as it's already 'in the
> > wild'.
> >
> > 4.9.1 will have to be it.
> >
> > It's pretty similar to what happened in log4j 1.2.15, some unintended
> > deps got in there. the .16 release fixed it.
> >
> > On 03/09/2011 04:55, Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> >> I don't think you'll be able to override an existing version in Maven
> >> Central, the best way is probably to release a 4.9.1.
> >>
> >
> >
> >
> > ------------------------------------
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
>

> Yahoo! Groups Links
